title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.23 - 24 | 30-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chaksharan Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: So, one more reason for Mother Earth to be aggrieved, feeling that grief is because the Kali Yuga began after Krishna's disappearance, after Krishna wound up His pastimes on the earth.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains the 23rd verse of the 16th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on the earth's grief after Krishna's departure and the beginning of Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: In fact, those seriously practicing pure devotional service are not at all interested in liberation, are not interested in any of the four Purusharthas, not interested in dharma, artha, kama, moksha.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Srila Prabhupada's purport, emphasizing that pure devotional service is far more relishable than liberation, making devotees disinterested in the four Purusharthas.

segments.key_quote: Simply by remembering such activities of the Lord, one can defy the pleasure derived from nirvana and reach the transcendental abode of the Lord to associate with Him and eternally engage in His blissful loving service.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the term 'nirvana vilambitani' and how devotional service minimizes the value of liberation, leading to eternal service in Krishnaloka.

segments.key_quote: Kala deteriorates everything that is created in the material world. That's a fact.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains the 24th verse, discussing the deteriorated condition of the earth after Krishna's departure due to the influence of time (kala).

segments.key_quote: The problem with material existence is people think they are independent. While the truth is we are entirely dependent on the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of recognizing our dependence on Krishna, contrasting it with the illusion of independence in material existence.

segments.key_quote: This material nature is completely controlled by Krishna under His superintendence everything is working, everything is happening.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating that material nature is controlled by Krishna and that the illusion of independence leads to suffering, ending with a thank you and Hare Krishna.
